news.title: UK has backed down on demand to access US Apple user data, spy chief says
news.summary: Tulsi Gabbard says Home Office no longer demanding ‘backdoor’ to encrypted material. US director of national intelligence posted the claim on X following a months-long dispute.

news.title: US surveillance firms run a victory lap amid Trump’s immigration crackdown
news.summary: TechScape is a weekly, offbeat look at what's happening in the world of tech. This week, Blake Montgomery looks at the latest in the field of artificial intelligence. Plus, Microsoft helps monitoring of Palestinian phone lines, Meta faces backlash over child safety.

news.title: Intel secures $2bn lifeline from Japan’s SoftBank
news.summary: SoftBank to invest $2bn (£1.5bn) in struggling US chip maker. Move expected to give it a 2% stake in the business. Comes amid reports US government is also considering taking a stake.

news.title: Drag x Drive review – wheelchair basketball that might give you wrist cramp
news.summary: Drag x Drive is the latest Nintendo Switch game to showcase the console's Joy-Con upgrades. You play competitive wheelchair basketball with the new mouse mode. A solid exhibition of a controller upgrade, to be sure, but Drag x Drive struggles to harness the high-octane nature of the real-world sport.
